entry.title: Revert "[BRP/clang-plugin] emit error for unsafe raw_ptr<T>/raw_ref<T> casting"
entry.content:
This reverts commit bfe42acde81cf7062e4cce8b64bf449de88b479e.



Reason for revert:

The tests fail (see bug).



Original change's description:

> [BRP/clang-plugin] emit error for unsafe raw_ptr/raw_ref casting

>

> - Add an option `check-bad-raw-ptr-cast-nested` to the clang plugin

> - When specified, bad casting check for `raw_ptr` or `raw_ref`

> becomes more strict

> - Add a class `CastingUnsafePredicate` to judge a type is "casting

> unsafe" or not.

> - `raw_ptr` or `raw_ref` are "casting unsafe"

> - Pointers, references and arrays of "casting unsafe" element(s) are

> "casting unsafe"

> - Classes and structs having a "casting unsafe" member are

> "casting unsafe"

> - Classes and structs having a "casting unsafe" base class are

> "casting unsafe"

> - Casting into/from "casting unsafe" is illegal if the casting type is

> one of followings:

> - `CK_BitCast`: `static_cast` or `reinretpret_cast`

> - `CK_LValueBitCast`: similar to above, but as a part of assignment

> to a reference

> - `CK_LValueToRValueBitCast`: `std::bit_cast` or `__builtin_bit_cast`

> - `CK_PointerToIntegral`, `CK_IntegralToPointer`: to prevent

> "pointer -> integral -> pointer" casting.

>

> Fixed: 1439745

> Change-Id: I584ec879c1211ee436de8f5e7cd46c49713b2d0b

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4482025

> Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

> Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1144534}

entry.title: kiosk: move IsKioskSession to components
entry.content:
IsKioskSession is a primary method to check if the device is in a kiosk

mode when called inside a browser.

Create //chromeos/components/kiosk for the kiosk shared code that

should be accessible from //components, //ash, //chromeos.



Move IsKioskSession to chromeos/components/kiosk to make it

available to the prospective callers in //ash, //chromeos,

//components.



The follow-up CP with callers from //components is planned.



We want to discourage usage of other methods to verify if the device

is in a kiosk mode, e.g. with UserManager that is not available in

lacros.



Bug=b:278663803

Test=compile

Test=browser_tests

entry.title: Replace event_latency tracing category with scroll_jank_metrics.
entry.content:
Include PresentedFrameInformation and InputHandlerProxy::HandleGestureScrollUpdate_Result trace events

in the new category, as well as InputLatency. For low-overhead

tracing, we want to include the minimum number of trace events to perform scroll jank analysis. At present, the input category

produces too many events, when we really only want

PresentedFrameInformation. The event_latency category has been

used to selectively record event_latency events in the low overhead

scenario, but is semantically too specific to use for metrics

related to scroll jank analysis.



Please note that atm low-overhead tracing is disabled and we will

need to merge the ScrollDeltas proto object with the Android

perfetto proto so this can be recorded.



Bug: b/271395016

Change-Id: Ied6d2430233d5caebc9bd71185a4bf530a99efd9

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[BestEffortServiceWorker] Use RaceNetworkRequest in the fallback case""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4f8dbd165bff009d47b8e4a8ebec1089e6e3259b.



Reason for revert: ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestBrowserTest.NetworkRequest_Wins_FetchHandler_Fallback flaky, mostly failing on fuchsia-x64-rel. The failures started after https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514795; the first failure https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/fuchsia-x64-rel/5895/overview.



Original change's description:

> Reland "[BestEffortServiceWorker] Use RaceNetworkRequest in the fallback case"

>

> This is a reland of commit 27c0797becaf3cb6ec5daaf3a97335c093328329

>

> Main diff from the original CL:

> - Split NetworkRequest_Wins_NotFound test into two small tests

> - Fix the bug that network errors are not handled in

> RaceNetworkRequestURLLoader::OnComplete.

> - Fix the bug that the fetch response is never committed when

> 1)RaceNetworkRequest result comes first and 2)the fetch handler result

> is a fallback, (1) and (2) are both satisfied.

>

>

> Original change's description:

> > [BestEffortServiceWorker] Use RaceNetworkRequest in the fallback case

> >

> > When the fetch handler result is a fallback,

> > ServiceWorkerMainResourceLoader runs the fallback callback,

> > ServiceWorkerSubresourceLoader creates another URLLoader, both classes

> > dispatches additional network request to get responses.

> >

> > Currently RaceNetworkRequest doesn't intervene in this fallback process.

> > This means the network request is dispatched twice (RaceNetworkRequest +

> > fallback), or even three times (+ SW fetch handlers).

> >

> > This CL changes that behavior, not to dispatch the fallback request when

> > RaceNetworkRequest is dispatched. Specifically, when the fetch handler

> > response is a fallback, the browser notifies to

> > RaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient to handle the response and ask to

> > complete the commit instead of the fetch handler.

> >

> > Change-Id: I71ea48dd797599261ba748246b4f4942dc3841e6

> > Bug: 1420517, 1443267

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4482480

> > Reviewed-by: Minoru Chikamune

> > Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> > Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> > Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1140664}

>

entry.title: Revert "Refactoring the race handling to be more comprehensive"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 166c98bac5909046e0ce35b7ef6056fdb26d54d7.



Reason for revert: ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestBrowserTest.NetworkRequest_Wins_FetchHandler_Fallback flaky, mostly failing on fuchsia-x64-rel. The failures started after https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514795; the first failure https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/fuchsia-x64-rel/5895/overview.



Reverting this CL first since it landed on top of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514795



Original change's description:

> Refactoring the race handling to be more comprehensive

>

> This is a refactoring CL to make the race condition handling more

> simpler and comprehensive.

>

> As the discussion in the previous CL pointed[1], it's very unlikely in

> theory but there could be the case that neither RaceNetworkRequest nor

> the fetch handler commits the response. Also, the previous CL introduces

> additional properties which manage the race condition between

> RaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient and the owner loader class, which are

> complicated.

>

> This CL removes below properties from the class:

> - `request_completed_` in RaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient

> - `is_fetch_handler_response_fallback_` in

> RaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient

> - `fetch_response_from_` in ServiceWorkerResourceLoader

>

> Instead, `commit_responsibility_` will be added to

> ServiceWorkerResourceLoader. It is the property replacing

> `fetch_response_from_`, and literally telling who should commit the

> response in the end, RaceNetworkRequest or the fetch handler. When the

> fallback or the network error happens, the client can tell the other

> side to commit the response. The race can just simply tell who is

> responsible to commit the final response, it doesn't have to know the

> state of the other side, like the fallback result of the fetch handler,

> the network error in RaceNetworkRequest etc.

>

> [1]

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514795/comment/21231808_966a5777/

>

> Change-Id: Id1e67915326d7888738a83b745539d8fff8d3658

> Bug: 1420517, 1443267

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4520238

> Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> Reviewed-by: Minoru Chikamune

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1144044}



Bug: 1420517, 1443267

entry.title: [iOS] Reset Reading List model bridge when NTP stops
entry.content:
When the NTP coordinator stops, the ContentSuggestionsMediator owned by

NewTabPageMediator does not release the reading list model bridge, causing some NTP unit tests to crash when the new DualReadingListModel

is enabled by flag.



More precisely, in the test's setting, the model is deallocated

before the ContentSuggestionsMediator, the never-freed model bridge

that the latter owns hits an already-freed model when trying to

unregister itself at deallocation.



This CL makes the ContentSuggestionsMediator reset the model bridge

pointer when disconnected.



Bug: 1445002

Change-Id: I467aea8be346f8741649f0378091a70fdc0cd957

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4526518

entry.title: [sync] Rename SyncSetupService::CanSyncFeatureStart()
entry.content:
As established during the code review for https://crrev.com/c/4489351,

on iOS both predicates, SyncService::CanSyncFeatureStart() and

SyncService::IsSyncFeatureEnabled() behave identically. This is because

ConsentLevel::kSync is granted together with SetFirstSetupComplete().



Theoretical exceptions include code exercised exactly between the

two nearby function calls, AuthenticationService::GrantSyncConsent()

and SyncSetupService::SetFirstSetupComplete(). Namely, this includes

IdentityManager observers, which would see that the new predicate

returns false.



SyncService::CanSyncFeatureStart() is going away, so it is better to

align the SyncSetupService API with the more modern name. The

implementation also migrates to SyncService::IsSyncFeatureEnabled(),

following the very same rationale that the two functions have the same

behavior on iOS.



Change-Id: I7938f6f181825e707829a38c39596aafe2d9f342

Bug: 1444344

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4526076

entry.title: Revert "Eagerly update the accessibility tree during the lifecycle step."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 47d4c4536a4f5659462a83e6f7d7a7296b5405e6.



Reason for revert: Speculative revert. All/DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityAriaErrorMessage/uia failing on win-asan, first failure https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/win-asan/26660/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Eagerly update the accessibility tree during the lifecycle step.

>

> What this this CL does:

> * Introduce a new dirty bit called needs_update_ that is meant to

> indicate whether step (2) below should happen for that AX object,

> or one of its descendants.

> * Implement a first piece of step (2): walk the AX tree from the root, updating children and attributes for

> all AX objects that have the dirty bit. Early out if the bit is not set.

>

> This CL is written (on purpose) to be a change that should have no

> effect on correctness (no effect, because the tree will still lazily

> update even if this update doesn't happen, or is incomplete). However,

> it may reduce the impact of existing bugs that only reproduce during

> lazy updates outside of rendering (such as during serialization or some other code path that reads AX data).

>

>

> This is one small step towards changing the lifecycle update code to

> be like this:

>

> 1. Invalidate parts of the AX tree (via methods like ProcessInvalidatedObjects, ProcessCleanLayoutCallbacks, and ProcessUpdatesWithCleanLayout).

>

> 2. Update the invalidated parts of the tree.

>

> This end state will avoid problems where tree updates happen

> unexpectedly, leading to crashes and other errors.

>

> Subsequent CLs will gradually reduce the amount of eager rebuilding

> that happens during (1) and do it in (2) instead, and also gradually

> replace code in (1) with dirty-bit setting.

>

> Follow-up tasks:

>

> 1. Add CHECKS for cached value accessors once https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4466969 lands.

>

> 2. Ensure that the second AX tree update only fixes maps and aria relations.

>

> Perf test results from blink_perf.accessibility:

>

> ProcessDeferredAccessibilityEvents got slower, and RenderAccessibilityImpl::SendPendingAccessibilityEvents got faster. The net difference was very small, about 16ms net across a number of tests. None of the blink_perf.accessibility tests got substantially

> slower (and a few got a little bit faster).

>

> Bug: 1342801

>

> Change-Id: Idf19a65658ed4878a24dec0e28c0a6e334609208

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4436950

> Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

> Commit-Queue: Chris Harrelson

> Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1144421}



Bug: 1342801

Change-Id: Ib2644410f6ca4769c1a3d3d9b371f97e8fa4f13f

No-Tree-Checks: true

No-Try: true

So far I've been erring on a side of caution, worrying that one would

entry.title: [scroll-animations] Remove CheckIfNeedsValidation
entry.content:
For deferred timelines v2, we need to be able to compute a timeline's

snapshot without side-effects. This CL removes the side effects of

creating scroller/subject layout data in Scroll/ViewTimeline

during the snapshot.



This tracking data is not needed anymore, since the snapshot now

contains both the scroller offsets and the view offsets,

so we can make the decisions on whether or not to update the snapshot

*inside* ValidateSnapshot.



AnchorScrollData should still only validate once (when it's newly

created), so we now track locally if validation already happened

in that case.



Bug: 1425939

entry.title: [text-wrap-pretty] Add `NGLineBreaker::OverrideAvailableWidth`
entry.content:
When asking `NGLineBreaker` to layout within a specified

available width, instead of passing a artificially modified

`line_opportunity`, this patch adds `OverrideAvailableWidth`.



The `line_opportunity` has effects other than available width,

such as BFC offsets, floating objects, and when it's copied to

`NGLineInfo`, the line width to apply `text-align`. The last

one was fixed in crrev.com/c/4304620 by saving and restoring

the `line_opportunity`.



To make the intention clearer and allow `NGLineBreaker` to

behave differently in that situation, `OverrideAvailableWidth`

tells that callsites want to use different available width

than the `line_opportunity`, only for computing line wrapping

purposes.



Bug: 1432798

entry.title: [iOS] Fix Find UI resigning first responder when tab grid closes on iPad
entry.content:
When Native Find in Page (with the iOS 16 Find panel) is triggered on

iPhone, the Find navigator view becomes first responder in a separate

window i.e. not the key window. On iPad however, the Find navigator view

is not present in the current window scene and does not seem accessible

so there is no way to check if it should act as the first responder.

This is a problem because when the tab switcher is dismissed, the tab

grid coordinator will only look for a first responder in the current

window scene.



This CL changes how the tab grid coordinator decides on a new first

responder once it is done dismissing the tab switcher and presenting a

tab view controller on top of it. Specifically, instead of simply

setting the current BVC as first responder if no first responder has

been found in the current window scene, the tab grid coordinator also

checks if the current web state (the one being presented) has an active

Find UI and if Find in Page uses the system Find panel. If so, then the

Find navigator should already be presented at this point and so it

should remain first responder.



As a result, if the Find UI is active in the current web state, instead

of ignoring it and setting the BVC as first responder, the Find panel

will now remain first responder.



Fixed: 1442502

Change-Id: Ifd581709fe63a40df68abc847dfd441ef7bc106c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4526023

entry.title: [//skia] Set `skia_use_dawn` to true by default
entry.content:
A prerequisite to running with Graphite is that `skia_use_dawn` be set

to true when building. This CL sets it to true by default in the

production code so that we can ensure that the code is buildable in

this state and facilitate straightforward local running with Graphite.



NOTE: This flag affects only Graphite code paths, so this CL will have

no impact on production code.

entry.title: Disable WebGLFloat test running on Nexus 5X with passthrough decoder

entry.title: Apply extent offset when touch selection dragging in Textfield.
entry.content:
crrev/c/4172684 added "expand by word, shrink by character" behaviour

when adjusting the text selection in Textfield using the touch handles

or scroll gestures. In this initial implementation, there is slightly

jumpy behaviour when switching from "expand by word" to "shrink by

character", since the selection endpoint jumps from the nearest word

boundary to the cursor position at the user's finger.



This CL smoothens the movement of the end of the selection by

implementing an offset when switching from word to character

granularity. This is based on the offset feature of

blink::DirectionGranularityStrategy:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/editing/granularity_strategy.h;l=58;drc=047c7dc4ee1ce908d7fea38ca063fa2f80f92c77



When initially switching from word to character granularity, we set the

offset as the horizontal displacement of the selection endpoint

from the extent point (i.e. user's finger position). We preserve the

offset if the extent moves in the opposite direction of the offset and

reduce the offset if the extent moves in the same direction, until the

offset becomes zero.



This should make it easier to slightly adjust the selection endpoint

when shrinking after "expand by word" behaviour, since the endpoint

will now move gradually away from the word boundary rather than

immediately jumping to the position of the user's finger.



Demo before: https://drive.google.com/file/d/10AM4dP1YYAXfFVh4JV_dk4XCof8h97cf/view?usp=sharing

Demo after: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GUUPg7Pr_x9K0PO2o8Mll20-rOdPw2F2/view?usp=sharing



Also add some basic multiline handling: reset the offset if a line

change is detected, and add tests for multiline "expand by word, shrink

by character" behaviour.



Bug: b:244116654, b:264824692

Change-Id: Ia23dff187414827f052a02590ce96eb67d48396f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4431254

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

Commit-Queue: Michelle Chen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1144548}

entry.title: [BRP/clang-plugin] emit error for unsafe raw_ptr<T>/raw_ref<T> casting
entry.content:
- Add an option `check-bad-raw-ptr-cast-nested` to the clang plugin

- When specified, bad casting check for `raw_ptr` or `raw_ref`

becomes more strict

- Add a class `CastingUnsafePredicate` to judge a type is "casting

unsafe" or not.

- `raw_ptr` or `raw_ref` are "casting unsafe"

- Pointers, references and arrays of "casting unsafe" element(s) are

"casting unsafe"

- Classes and structs having a "casting unsafe" member are

"casting unsafe"

- Classes and structs having a "casting unsafe" base class are

"casting unsafe"

- Casting into/from "casting unsafe" is illegal if the casting type is

one of followings:

- `CK_BitCast`: `static_cast` or `reinretpret_cast`

- `CK_LValueBitCast`: similar to above, but as a part of assignment

to a reference

- `CK_LValueToRValueBitCast`: `std::bit_cast` or `__builtin_bit_cast`

- `CK_PointerToIntegral`, `CK_IntegralToPointer`: to prevent

"pointer -> integral -> pointer" casting.



Fixed: 1439745

Change-Id: I584ec879c1211ee436de8f5e7cd46c49713b2d0b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4482025

Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

entry.title: Fix flaky select-text-overflow-ellipsis.html test
entry.content:
The above mentioned test is flaky on Mac platforms. The flakiness

occurs because sometimes the test window is inactive, leading to an

inactive selection color (gray) versus the expected active selection

color (blue). Since there is no deterministic way to set the window as

active from JS, the test is being fixed by setting the color and

background-color for active and inactive selection to be the same. This

will ensure that the selection colors will always align with the

baseline, regardless of whether the window is active or not.



There are few other similar tests that may encounter the same issue.

Those are also being updated herewith.



Bug: 1412886

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix quota check.
entry.content:
Turns out the transaction size was only counting the value and the

key, but not the external objects that are created to back the

value when it's a blob. Therefore blobs were allowed to ignore

quota restrictions. (OTOH, blobs were correctly being counted

for `estimate()`.)



This also hopefully deflakes the associated WPT (which previously

placed the too-large data in the key, hence was testing the

enforcement of quota against the key).

entry.title: Reland: [Mac] Fix duplicate char issue in JPN IME when [left] key is pressed
entry.content:
---------------------------

The differences from the original CL [1] by shihken@:

* Fix a crash by base::checked_cast() in gfx::Range

constructor with uninitialized _markedRange.location. We should

access _markedRange only if _hasMarkedText.

* Guard the behavior change by MacImeLiveConversionFix flag.

---------------------------



This CL handles an edge case for the "Live Conversion" feature in

default Japanese IME. When the feature is on, pressing the left key

at the composition boundary will reconvert previously committed text.

The text input system will call setMarkedText multiple times

to end the current composition and start a new one (see bug

1328530 for more details about the event sequence.) In this case

we'll need to call ImeSetComposition in setMarkedText instead keyEvent:,

otherwise, only the info from the last setMarkedText will be processed

(which causes the duplicate char issue since the text input system

would remove the reconverted texts first then re-insert, and we miss

the removing part).



Note since with existing IME test APIs it's non-trivial to write tests

for this particular reconversion scenario (one left key triggers several

setMarkedText), this CL is manually verified and the result after

the patch can be found in

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1328530#c3



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3662187



Bug: 1328530

Change-Id: I4202e12dce5fc95d2b24b7061467211fe5c0fae4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4516058

Commit-Queue: Kent Tamura

entry.title: Wait for keyup to fire scrollend on key scrolls
entry.content:
Currently, a key scroll triggers a scroll animation which fires

scrollend when complete. This is a problem for keyboard scrolls

triggered by repeated keys because operating systems insert a delay between the

first keydown and the subsequent repeating keydown events. This means

that if this delay is large enough, the animation created for the first

keydown may finish before the second keydown event comes in and we may

fire scrollend prematurely and also fire it twice for a single keyboard

scroll.



This patch changes the way we handle scrolls generated by keyboard

events by relying on the accompanying keyup as a signal to fire

scrollend.

In some instances, the keyup may fire before the scroll actually

concludes. This patch makes sure we fire scrollend at the later of the

two.



One thing to note about this approach is that it means when a scroll

reaches the extent of the scrolling container, we will not fire

scrollend until the user releases the key. I think this is okay since it matches the behavior when dragging the scrollbar thumb.



I would have added a test that simluates the initial key repeat delay but

it appears we do not have support for keydown and keyup events in

testdriver[1] and I'm not sure if there's another way to achieve the

same effect.

entry.title: [ATP] Implements skeleton TTS API in the A11y Service
entry.content:
Implements a skeleton TTS API in the Accessibility Service V8.

Eventually this API will be the same shape as chrome.tts extension API,

for the parts of chrome.tts that a11y features need.



Implements plumbing for one part of the API, chrome.tts.getVoices,

such that ATP JS can call chrome.tts.getVoices and receive a callback

with whatever voices are available in the OS from the browser

process.



For more, see the go/chromeos-atp-v8-design subsection on "C++ to

Javascript bindings, and go/chromeos-atp-api-tts, specific to the

TTS API.

site-initiated mirroring sites. This would override the MediaController

controls would not appear in the cast dialog.

entry.title: CodeHealth: FakeWebAppProvider::Set* disconnects instead of doing it in Get()
entry.content:
Setting a subsystem on FakeWebAppProvider after it's started, or using a

subsystem before it's connected is a potential error, because the

subsystems won't be connected together properly. To prevent this,

FakeWebAppProvider::Get() was setting `connected_ = false` to force

`Start()` to be called to connect the subsystems. This has the

unfortunate side effect of making `Get` mutate the state so it can't be

used as a regular getter.



This CL makes `Get` non-mutating and instead makes each `Set*` method

ensure connected_ = false.



Possible unit tests this would simplify (no longer need to hold a

FakeWebAppProvider field:

https://source.chromium.org/search?q=raw_ptr.*FakeWebAppProvider%5C%3E&sq=package:chromium



Change-Id: I3e67d612abc89ff0702dd0ddaa2c697d279f39a8

entry.title: Keep track of last provisioning attempt on Android R
entry.content:
On Android R a bug in the OS can cause MediaDrm::getProvisionRequest()

to crash. As this may happen shortly after startup when

pre-provisioning, Chrome will be unusable if that happens.

So use |kLastProvisioningTimeToken| to keep track of the last attempt

to pre-provision, and don't try again within |kExpirationDelta|.

Value is cleared if provisioning returns, so on devices without

the crash things will work as normal.



Tested on Android R emulator with a simulated crash inside

MediaDrmBridge.java.



Bug: 1430660

Test: see above

entry.title: [Read Anything]: make mock blocks more explicit
entry.content:
"When it’s being destroyed, your friendly mock object will automatically

verify that all expectations on it have been satisfied"[1].



This means each instance of EXPECT_CALL simply queue up an expectation

but it isn't checked until the end of the test. The RA tests seem to use

mocks as if expectations get checked in-between EXPECT_CALL(s) which

isn't true.



1. http://google.github.io/googletest/gmock_cook_book.html



R=abigailbklein@google.com



Bug: none

Test: cq

Change-Id: I05d662ce934a687ea3423f16d3753760daa6f3a2

entry.title: Remove test coverage of QR metrics logged in the utility process.
entry.content:
I've forgotten that testing of UMA metrics logged in the utility process

is inherently flaky - see https://crbug.com/1246137. To avoid the

flakiness this CL removes test coverage for such UMA metrics. Less test

coverage should still be okay, because the code logging the metrics is

fairly simple and the UMA dashboard (e.g. see go/rusty-qr-metrics) shows

that the metrics are logged.

verified in DCHECK builds. Converting it to NOTREACHED() to have it dump

non-fatally until we can make it NOTREACHED_NORETURN().
